definition: to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions
to pay/to hand over to/classifier for pairs or sets of things
transfer payment (payment from government or private sector for which no good or service is required in return)

sentences.english: If I want to buy a car, I have to offer enough money to get it.
sentences.chinese: 若我想買一輛車，便要支付足夠的金錢。

sentences.english: All their costs, including study and living expenses, will be covered by the fund.
sentences.chinese: 包括通信費在內的大部分支出，都會由公司支付。

sentences.english: Invoiced packaging on loan will not be paid for; it will be returned carriage paid.
sentences.chinese: 包裝費不單獨支付，而是與運費一起支付。

sentences.english: Invoiced packaging on loan will not be paid for; it will be returned carriage paid.
sentences.chinese: 包裝費不單獨支付，而是與運費一起支付。

sentences.english: The Works shall be measured, and valued for payment, in accordance with this Clause.
sentences.chinese: 應對工程依據本款進行測量並確定其支付價值。

sentences.english: So the owner must pay attention to this, to control cost in construction stage consciously.
sentences.chinese: 工程結算支付是承包工程合同管理的核心。

sentences.english: B: Each day, we will be charged for one thousandth of the contract amount.
sentences.chinese: 每天支付合同總金額的千分之一。

sentences.english: How many common people could afford such expensive fees?
sentences.chinese: 有多少平民百姓能夠支付得起這樣昂貴的“面聖”費？

sentences.english: And in the meantime, they'd pay the banks interest on thosebonds.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，它們也用債券支付銀行的利息。

sentences.english: Developer will sign an agreement with each participant for the fee payment.
sentences.chinese: 承辦方將與各投標單位簽訂協議，以支付相應費用。

sentences.english: Retirement accounts and savings, they say, have been drained to pay legal fees.
sentences.chinese: 用來支付訴訟費用的退休金賬戶和儲蓄已被耗盡。

sentences.english: The organizer will not pay the design cost of disqualified design schemes.
sentences.chinese: 無效成果文件的設計機構，主辦方將不予支付成本費。

sentences.english: P90 I want " to " do exercise, but I really do not have the money to pay tuition fees.
sentences.chinese: 我想要做的P90鍛鍊，但我真的沒有錢支付學費。

sentences.english: I need only to sell 2 bowls of porridge to recover my rent.
sentences.chinese: 我只需賣兩碗粥就可以支付我的小時租金了。

sentences.english: Fourth, rural families in Huanggang City have very limited capacity to pay for higher education.
sentences.chinese: 第四，黃岡市農村家庭高等教育支付能力十分有限。
帶有網站擔保支付功能。

definition: to pay a sum of money/payment
to pay/to hand over (tax payment etc)
to pay sb else's expense with the expectation of being reimbursed by that person later
to return (sth borrowed etc)/to send back/to refund/to rebate
restitution/return of something to its original owner/remittance
to pay/to hand over to/classifier for pairs or sets of things
to transfer (money to a bank account)
